outputs.name: sky
outputs.description: A honeybee sky that can be used to create a point-in-time recipe.

inputs.name: north_
inputs.description:
A number between 0 and 360 that represents the degrees off from
the y-axis to make North. This can also be a vector to set the North.
Default is 0. The default North direction is the Y-axis (0 degrees).

inputs.name: _month_
inputs.description: An integer between 1 and 12 for the month of the year (default: 6).

inputs.name: _day_
inputs.description: An integer between 1 and 31 for the day of the month (default: 21).

inputs.name: _hour_
inputs.description: A number between 0 and 23.999 for the hour of the day (default: 12).

inputs.name: _type_
inputs.description:
An integer between 0..5 to indicate CIE Sky Type (default: 0).
* 0 = Sunny with sun
* 1 = sunny without sun
* 2 = intermediate with sun
* 3 = intermediate without sun
* 4 = cloudy sky
* 5 = uniform sky

code:
try:
    from ladybug_geometry.geometry2d.pointvector import Vector2D
except ImportError as e:
    raise ImportError('\nFailed to import ladybug_geometry:\n\t{}'.format(e))

try:
    from honeybee_radiance.lightsource.sky import CIE
except ImportError as e:
    raise ImportError('\nFailed to import honeybee_radiance:\n\t{}'.format(e))

try:  # import ladybug_{{cad}} dependencies
    from ladybug_{{cad}}.{{plugin}} import all_required_inputs
    from ladybug_{{cad}}.togeometry import to_vector2d
except ImportError as e:
    raise ImportError('\nFailed to import ladybug_{{cad}}:\n\t{}'.format(e))

import math


if all_required_inputs(ghenv.Component):
    # process the north input
    north_ = north_ or 0
    try:  # it's a vector
        north_ = math.degrees(to_vector2d(north_).angle_clockwise(Vector2D(0, 1)))
    except AttributeError:  # north angle instead of vector
        north_ = float(north_)

    # set default values if they are not set
    _type_ = 0 if _type_ is None else _type_
    _month_ = 6 if _month_ is None else _month_
    _day_ = 21 if _day_ is None else _day_
    _hour_ = 12 if _hour_ is None else _hour_

    # create the sky object
    sky = CIE.from_location(_location, _month_, _day_, _hour_, _type_, north_)
name: HB CIE Standard Sky
description:
Create a point-in-time standard Radiance CIE sky.
-
